articles.title: Reproducible science workshop
articles.contents:
Who: Olivier
Gimenez
When: 9am-4pm on March 18, 2021
Where: Zoom
Timeline
Motivations [lecture | video]
Manipulating data in the tidyverse [lecture | practical | solutions | video]
Visualising data in the tidyverse [lecture | practical | solutions | video]
Lunch break
Writing dynamic and reproducible documents with
R Markdown [lecture |
practical | solutions | video]
Versioning with Git and GitHub in
RStudio [lecture | practical | video]
Take-home messages [lecture |
video]
Requirements
Download and install Git.
You will need a GitHub account, you can easily set up a free
account here.
Install R
and RStudio
Have Git, GitHub and RStudio talk to each other following these
guidelines (section 2.2.2 Configuration only).
Install the following R packages:
tidyverse, sf, emo,
janitor, palmerpenguins, usethis
and lubridate. You can install them all at once by running
the following code in the R command line:


install.packages(c("tidyverse", "sf", "emo", "janitor", "palmerpenguins", "usethis", "lubridate"))



Corrections
If you see mistakes or want to suggest changes, please create
an issue on the source repository.
Reuse
Text and figures are licensed under Creative Commons Attribution CC BY 4.0. Any
computer code (R, HTML, CSS, etc.) in slides and worksheets, including
in slide and worksheet sources, is also licensed under MIT.
